title: Wanted: Photos of the Bauer Type Foundry
content:
Dear Type Lovers and Researchers:

As part of my senior thesis work I am making a flash video about the history of Futura, complete with a discussion of the Bauhaus movement, a healthy dose of the font’s integration of geometric forms, and its use in Nazi propaganda. I have photos to fit my every need in the project, except for one: a pic of the Bauer type foundry where it was commissioned. I have done extensive research on the internet, to no avail. Does anyone here know where I could find one (or would be willing to post their pic)? Any help is much appreciated - AND I’ll be willing to throw in an amazing, limited-time offer: a viewing of the finished video, online :P.

Thanks and cheerio  
beatleblaker

author: beatleblaker

comments.content: I don’t have a photo, but type foundries sometimes put photos or engravings of their buildings in specimen books. [Try getting some Bauer Specimen books sent via inter-library loan and see what turns up](http://web.archive.org/web/20080929161016/http:/www.worldcat.org/search?qt=worldcat_org_all&q=specimen+book+of+bauer+types).

_I have done extensive research on the internet_

well, hmmm. That’s a great punchline.

For permissions and possibly more information about Bauer than you may need, try contacting Wolfgang Hartmann at Neufville  
 [http://www.neufville.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20080929161016/http:/www.neufville.com/ "http://www.neufville.com")
